metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18660 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 5.4.1 on powerpc allows Information Exposure because the Spectre-RSB mitigation is not in place for all applicable CPUs, aka CID-39e72bf96f58. This is related to arch/powerpc/kernel/entry_64.S and arch/powerpc/kernel/security.c. Anthony Steinhauser discovered that the Linux kernel did not properly perform Spectre_RSB mitigations to all processors for PowerPC architecture systems in some situations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-171-generic - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-lowlatency - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-171-generic - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-171-lowlatency - 4.4.0-171.200
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-171.200').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.111').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.56').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1064.71').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.136').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-171.200').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.56').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.139').
